title: Directs the office of inspector general to develop a plan to publicize the existence of phone line to report instances of governmental waste and fraud
summary: Directs the office of inspecter general to develop a plan to publicize the existence of a toll free telephone to report instances of governmental waste and fraud; provides such plan include methods of direct advertising, postings in state offices and other public buildings and public service announcements.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1488

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. TEDISCO, BARCLAY, BURLING, CROUCH, KOLB, RAIA --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. McKEVITT, OAKS, SAYWARD  --  read  once
         and referred to the Committee on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to reporting instances of
         governmental fraud and waste

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new section 6-a to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S 6-A. REPORTING FRAUD AND WASTE. 1. IT IS THE DESIRE OF THE  LEGISLA-
    4  TURE  TO  IDENTIFY  AND  ROOT OUT ANY INSTANCES OF FRAUD OR WASTE IN THE
    5  OPERATION OF STATE GOVERNMENT OR IN ANY OF THE PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY,
    6  THROUGH OR UNDER A STATE AGENCY. THE INPUT OF CITIZENS OF THE  STATE  IS
    7  CRUCIAL  IN  IDENTIFYING SUCH INSTANCES OF FRAUD.  THE GOVERNOR, THROUGH
    8  THE OFFICE OF THE INSPECTOR GENERAL, OPERATES A TOLL-FREE TELEPHONE LINE
    9  ON WHICH CITIZENS OF THE STATE MAY INFORM STATE OFFICIALS  OF  INSTANCES
   10  OF  FRAUD OR WASTE. IT IS THE DESIRE OF THE LEGISLATURE TO PUBLICIZE THE
   11  AVAILABILITY OF THIS TOLL-FREE LINE SO AS TO ENCOURAGE ITS  USE  BY  THE
   12  CITIZENS OF THE STATE.
   13    2.  THE  OFFICE OF THE INSPECTOR GENERAL IS DIRECTED TO DEVELOP A PLAN
   14  TO PUBLICIZE THE EXISTENCE OF THE TOLL-FREE  TELEPHONE  LINE  TO  REPORT
   15  INSTANCES  OF GOVERNMENTAL FRAUD AND WASTE. SUCH PLAN IS TO BE COMPLETED
   16  WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF THE  EFFECTIVE  DATE  OF  THIS  SECTION  AND  SHALL
   17  INCLUDE  METHODS OF DIRECT ADVERTISING THROUGH POSTINGS IN STATE OFFICES
   18  AND OTHER PUBLIC BUILDINGS AND THROUGH PUBLIC SERVICE  ANNOUNCEMENTS  IN
   19  THE  BROADCAST  MEDIA. IN ADDITION, THE PLAN SHALL INCLUDE THE PLACEMENT
   20  OF THE  TOLL-FREE  TELEPHONE  NUMBER  ON  FORMS  WHICH  ARE  CUSTOMARILY
   21  DISTRIBUTED  BY  THE  STATE,  ITS  DEPARTMENTS,  AGENCIES AND ITS PUBLIC
   22  AUTHORITIES TO MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC. NOTHING CONTAINED IN THIS  SECTION
   23  SHALL BE INTERPRETED AS LIMITING THE MEANS OR METHODS OF ADVERTISING THE
   24  EXISTENCE OF THE TOLL-FREE TELEPHONE LINE.
   25    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01472-01-1
